definition: to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
to conform to no conventional pattern/unconventional/offbeat

sentences.english: Whose would be man , must be a nonconformist .
sentences.chinese: 任何一个真正的人都肯定是不落俗套的人。

sentences.english: Spontaneity is one of the key elements of creativity.
sentences.chinese: 自发性，不落俗套就是创造性中最关键的因素。

sentences.english: What I specially like about the oil-painting is its originality.
sentences.chinese: 我特别喜欢这幅油画的地方是它不落俗套。

definition: to conform to no conventional pattern/unconventional/offbeat
not follow the beaten track/have an original style
to act cleverly to get what one desires/to get the best at least expense
able to withstand careful appreciation/well worth a second look
to cater to the public's taste/kitsch/commercial
